channel.title: Pages on Initiative on Dravidian Culture & Languages
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Initiative on Dravidian Culture & Languages

item.title: About
item.description: Language is Identity Understanding culture requires knowledge of the language. They demonstrate the uniqueness and values of cultures all over the world. Languages link us to our past and present, an individual’s identity, and to the values that nurture that person. Initiative on Dravidian Culture and Languages (IDCL) aims to create awareness about indigenous languages, promote the linguistic diversity of India and provide a digital space for people from different cultures to interact with one another.

item.title: Documentation
item.description: Documentation The importance of language preservation has become a necessity in this age of globalisation. More than 3000 languages in the world are considered as endangered. This means that about half of the world’s linguistic identity is currently under threat. Linguistically diverse countries like India are struggling to conserve many of their indigenous languages. Major languages are driving minority languages into extinction, and the lack of effective government programmes are pushing these underprivileged communities into an identity crisis.
